Issues.Title: SwUpdate.available does not fire in chrome (desktop) anymore
Issues.Body:
Hi,

when we upgraded from 10.0 to 10.1 we observed that SwUpdate.available does not fire anymore on chrome desktop.
We tested v83, v85 and v86. Chrome on android still fires, safari fires, firefox fires.
Updates are getting installed, just the observable does not emit anymore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "SwUpdate.available does not fire in chrome (desktop) anymore" (#38877)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): always return a mutable clone from `Scope#resolve`
Issues.Body:
This change prevents comments from a resolved node from appearing at
each location the resolved expression is used and also prevents callers
of `Scope#resolve` from accidentally modifying / adding comments to the
declaration site.


Note: This is targeting `major` because it modifies the `TcbReferenceOp` which was merged only to `major`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(compiler): always return a mutable clone from `Scope#resolve`" (#38857)

Issues.Title: ERROR: Unable to write a reference to ... when building monorepo-style libraries
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Monorepository-style libraries import directly from `/projects` instead of `/dist`, e.g. ~~~ $ cat projects/lib-b/tsconfig.lib.json { "extends": "../../tsconfig.json", "compilerOptions": { "paths": { "lib-a": [ "projects/lib-a/src/public-api", ], [...] ~~~ The advantage is that libraries do not need a separate build step. This is kinda undocumented and was initially not supported, but apparently is now: * https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/29361 * https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/33828/files Building an app consuming those libraries seems to work (knock on wood), but building individual libraries fails. Its not clear if building individual libraries should work in that context, but it would be nice to compile if even for type checking and testing library orders. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Minimal reproduction https://github.com/vbraun/angular-monorepo-bug with two libraries, such that lib-b imports from lib-a. Building lib-a works fine, building lib-b fails ~~~~ $ npx ng build --project lib-b Building Angular Package ****************************************************************************** It is not recommended to publish Ivy libraries to NPM repositories. Read more here: https://v9.angular.io/guide/ivy#maintaining-library-compatibility ****************************************************************************** ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Building entry point 'lib-b' ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Compiling TypeScript sources through ngc ERROR: Unable to write a reference to SpaceComponent in /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/space.component.ts from /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/lib-a.module.ts An unhandled exception occurred: Unable to write a reference to SpaceComponent in /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/space.component.ts from /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/lib-a.module.ts See "/tmp/ng-TS65y3/angular-errors.log" for further details. ~~~~ ## üî• Exception or Error The log file says: ~~~ $ cat /tmp/ng-TS65y3/angular-errors.log [error] Error: Unable to write a reference to SpaceComponent in /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/space.component.ts from /var/tmp/angular/tulip/projects/lib-a/src/lib/lib-a.module.ts at ReferenceEmitter.emit (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/imports/src/emitter.js:85:19) at Object.toR3Reference (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/util.js:249:31) at NgModuleDecoratorHandler._toR3Reference (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/ng_module.js:418:31) at /var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/ng_module.js:194:83 at Array.map () at NgModuleDecoratorHandler.analyze (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/ng_module.js:194:48) at TraitCompiler.analyzeTrait (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/transform/src/compilation.js:346:40) at analyze (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/transform/src/compilation.js:298:58) at _loop_1 (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/transform/src/compilation.js:320:21) at TraitCompiler.analyzeClass (/var/tmp/angular/tulip/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/transform/src/compilation.js:326:35) ~~~ ## Issues.Title: can't run multiple ngcc builds in parallel from a single node_modules
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

@angular/compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

Technically, no, but things like this used to work just fine with older versions of Angular.

### Description

Oftentimes, running npm install is a long pole task when running CI/CD jobs. In my case, I have a monorepo from which I build many libraries. I have a pipeline that has a prepare stage/job, which runs npm install into a common node_modules directory, and then I spawn about 20 different jobs in parallel which build the libraries. Currently, things are not working well with Angular 10 because the lock file path is hard-coded into the node_modules directory, and ngcc seems to randomly fail when it sometimes finds a lock file already in place.

The location of the lock file is hard-coded in https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d1ea1f4c7f3358b730b0d94e65b00bc28cae279c/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/locking/lock_file.ts#L11

It would be great if this could either be configurable, or not inside node_modules, but instead in a tmp directory near where the ng build command is being executed.

## üî• Exception or Error

Error: Lock found, but no process with PID 40 seems to be running.
(If you are sure no ngcc process is running then you should delete the lock-file at /builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__.)
    at new TimeoutError (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/locking/async_locker.js:18:51)
    at AsyncLocker.<anonymous> (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/locking/async_locker.js:111:47)
    at step (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:140:27)
    at Object.next (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:121:57)
    at /builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:114:75
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at Object.__awaiter (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:110:16)
    at AsyncLocker.create (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/locking/async_locker.js:68:28)
    at AsyncLocker.<anonymous> (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/locking/async_locker.js:51:59)
    at step (/builds/core-build/vmw-ngx-components/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:140:27)
An unhandled exception occurred: NGCC failed.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "can't run multiple ngcc builds in parallel from a single node_modules" (#38875)

Issues.Title: Problems with animations when viewContainerRef change Ivy Angular9
Issues.Body:
# üêû Problems with animations when viewContainerRef change ### Affected Package @angular ### Is this a regression? works without ivy compilation in Angular v8. actually **not working with Angular 9.2 and ivy compilation.** ### Description In a proyect with [DinamicLoaderComponents with AdDirective](https://angular.io/guide/dynamic-component-loader), load a component in container that have a material-sidenav or angular-animations declarations, after deteach this view for save the componentRef to after restore in the same container . When restore the view the sidenav Animation or animationAngular failed and block it, its necessary change the value of trigger to reset status animation. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction In the stackblitz explample I use one class (ClientComponent) to instance two components with FactoryResolver, save the componentRef, deteach view in container and after restore in the container with .insert() (comment in code). Reproduction: 1. Load component 1 (click "Load Client 1" Button). 2. Open sidenav and animation (click "TOOGLE SIDENAV" and animationText). 3. With sidenav open and animation text visible change the view to client2 (click "Load Client 2" Button). 4. Now restore view Client 1 (click "Load Client 1" Button). **ERROR ->** Failer animation and sidenav styles its necessary toogle sidenav or animation two times for to working. Only failed with EnablyIvy option, if disable enableIvy in settings of stackblitz working fine. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-9-bugsanimations?file=src/app/app.component.ts NOTE: if i remove alls animations decorators [@---] works too. ## üî• Exception or Error The animations of angular not working correctly. ## üåç Your Environment nodeJs v12 **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: Linker babel translator
Issues.Body:
refactor(compiler-cli): implement `BabelAstFactory` and `AstHost`s

This commit adds the `AstHost` interface, along with implementations for
both Babel and TS.

It also implements the Babel vesion of the `AstFactory` interface, along
with a linker specific implementation of the `ImportGenerator` interface.

These classes will be used by the new "ng-linker" to transform prelinked
library code using a Babel plugin.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Linker babel translator" (#38866)

Issues.Title: Production mode "No component factory found error"
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/cli packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/cli


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I am using angular 8 application and I will move it to angular 10. But I noticed an issue with working dynamic components.

I have multiple components that will be dynamically compile on runtime.

- FirstComponent
- SecondComponent
- ThirdComponent
- .......

I am selecting one of them from a configuration JSON that saved on my database. And I am using following code to find class name.

```
  private getComponentFactory(name: string, resolver: ComponentFactoryResolver) {
    const factories = Array.from<any>(resolver['_factories'].keys());

    const factoryClass = <Type<any>>factories.find((item: any) => item.name === name);

    return resolver.resolveComponentFactory(factoryClass);
  }
```
This  code works while developing application. But when I build application using `--prog` parameter, it throws an error:

> Error: No component factory found for undefined. Did you add it to @NgModule.entryComponents?

I think the application prod mode uglifies the component name, but my component `name `parameter is not uglified. Because name parameter is coming from databse as JSON. 

Is there any suport to use dynamic components with name?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Production mode "No component factory found error"" (#38864)

Issues.Title: queueMicrotask() not patched in zone.js
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by zone.js patching ### Is this a regression? If that assumption is correct then this is a bug as there doesn't seem to be any patching going on for queueMicrotask() ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [StackBlitz]( https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-37xdhh?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts ) ## üåç Your Environment **Zone Version:** zone.js@0.11.1 **Anything else relevant?** [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/queueMicrotask) [CanIUse](https://caniuse.com/mdn-api_windoworworkerglobalscope_queuemicrotask)

Issues.Title: docs: Delete repeated section "Removed APIs"
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Build of application triggers also build of library
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Building the application in multiproject workspace has an unexpected side effect of rebuilding also a library whose module is imported in the application. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a fresh multiproject workspace containing a library and an application: ```bash ng new my-workspace --create-application=false cd my-workspace ng generate library my-lib ng generate application my-app ``` 2. Build a library using `ng build my-lib --prod` 1. Note the content and timestamp of built `package.json` in `dist/my-lib` 1. Import library's module into application's AppModule: ```typescript // my-app's app.module.ts import { MyLibModule } from 'my-lib'; // add this ``` 5. Build an application using `ng build my-app --prod` 1. Note that content and timestamp of `package.json` in `dist-my-lib` has changed. Most interestingly it is no longer a production build of a library as a package.json now contains ```json "scripts": { "prepublishOnly": "node --eval \"console.error('ERROR: Trying to publish a package that has been compiled by NGCC. This is not allowed.\\nPlease delete and rebuild the package, without compiling with NGCC, before attempting to publish.\\nNote that NGCC may have been run by importing this package into another project that is being built with Ivy enabled.\\n')\" && exit 1" } ``` which prevents it from being published. ## :heavy_check_mark: Expected result Building an application should not have a side-effect of rebuilding also imported library. What's worse is that application build ignores the fact that `-prod`was used and when building the library it produces non-prod build. This unexpected behaviour gets especially nasty when running CI where you build a prod build of your library (ready to publish), then build an application on which you run some tests to see if you lib behaves correctly and if so you want to publish the library - well you can not as it has been rebuilt non-prod :disappointed: Also in the docs at https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries#building-and-rebuilding-your-library it is stated that you need to build you library when you make changes to it so they are reflected in your app, but it seem that due to this issue it is build for you... ## üåç Your Environment 

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): source span for microsyntax bindings should be the bin‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ding span In a microsyntax expression, the source spans of the individual bindings should to be distinguished from each other and only contain the relavent parts. ```
``` In this example, the current source span for `ngForTrackBy` and `ngForOf` are both the entire span `*ngFor="let item of items; trackBy: trackByFn"`. With this change, the source span for `ngForOf` would be `of items; ` and the source span for `ngForTrackBy` would be `trackBy: trackByFn`.

Issues.Title: Cannot bind SafeUrl to SVGImageElement
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is likely caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No. If it is a regression, I'm not aware of it. ### Description I have a template that is a more complex version of this: ```html ``` At runtime, no image is shown, no error is in the JavaScript console, and the DOM look like this (simplified): ```html ``` Is suspect that the proper binding for SafeUrls to _SVGImageElement.href_ is missing. When I use an [href] binding instead of [attr.href] Angular tells me that I'm trying to bind to a readonly property. ##### Context This is part of an Apache Cordova project targeting the latest iOS version. _iOS/cordova-ios@6_ considers the _file:_ protocol to be unsafe, so we use the synthetic _app://localhost_ protocol and host. That's probably why Angular deems the URLs to be unsafe. We wrap them using _DomSanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustUrl()_, but it seems that we can only use SafeUrls with specific bindings, which don't exist for SVGImageElements. We use SVGs to support taking notes on images. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Exception or Error 
SafeValue must use [property]=binding: app://localhost/path/image.png (see http://g.co/ng/security#xss)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): widen scrollbar for accessibility
Issues.Body:
This commit widens the webkit scroll bar. This makes it easier
to grab the scroll bar using assistive technology and devices,
and provides a wider target for those who have dexterity issues.
The width is now a minimum of 1rem, which is scalable so if the
user needs to zoom content for visibility, the scroll bar
width zooms with it.

Issues.Title: Add ability to fake date in jest tests or make `fakeAsync` work with `jest.useFakeTimers('modern')` and `jest.setSystemTime`
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for zone.js


### Description
I want to use fake dates in my jest tests (just like `jasmine.clock`), while using `fakeAsync` when I'm testing async functions. 

A recent addition to jest is the modern fake timers, which uses Sinon's fake timers that allows (among other things) to fake `date.now`.


### Describe the solution you'd like
I think we should write a patch for jest's `useFakeTimers`, or add the ability to fake the date natively in zone (by exposing `FakeDate` somehow and manipulating it). 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I wrote it in the section above - 2 ways to solve this problem - patch jest's `setSystemTime` or expose a way to set a fake date manually by zone.js

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add ability to fake date in jest tests or make `fakeAsync` work with `jest.useFakeTimers('modern')` and `jest.setSystemTime`" (#38851)

Issues.Title: Lazy-loaded module in new project gives "…µ…µdefineComponent is not a function" / Fixed by changing .browserslistrc
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Unknown ### Is this a regression? Possibly. A new project created in version 9.1 does not have this issue. ### Description I created a new project today using the following: ng new testapp --packageManager=yarn --skipGit=true --routing=true --style=scss ng generate module test --module=app --routing --route=test (then I emptied app.component.html and added ) ng build When I visit the /test route in the _latest_ Firefox or Chrome, the developer console shows the error below. Running from the webpack dev server does not exhibit the issue. This is strange, but I determined that the problem goes away after editing .browserslistrc to change "last 1 Chrome version" to "last 25 Chrome versions". Today this equates to Chrome versions 60-85. Using 'last 1' thru 24 all fail. It's also fixed by adding "> 0.5%". This existed in a new install with Angular 9. It seems this equates to just Chrome versions 83-85. Adding "maintained node versions" also prevents the error. Sorry ahead of time. I'm aware this could be all my fault or maybe a bug in the browserslist library. Just seems like a brand new install would be fine and it took a long time to track down. I checked similar lazy-load examples in the tutorials and they work, but the Stackblitz projects I reviewed didn't have a browserslist file. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/davehasagithub/ngtemp First commit was from ng new, second from ng generate plus an updated app.component.html--that's it! ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: build: update postcss to version 8.0.5
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | dependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.5`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.5) | | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | devDependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.5`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.5) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/postcss ### [`v8.0.5`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​805) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.4...8.0.5) - Update changelog. ### [`v8.0.4`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​804) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.3...8.0.4) - Fixed `Cannot read property 'line' of null` error. - Fixed source map support for declarations. ### [`v8.0.3`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​803) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.2...8.0.3) - Fixed client-side bundling support. ### [`v8.0.2`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​802) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.1...8.0.2) - Fixed plugin packs support. ### [`v8.0.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​801) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.0...8.0.1) - Updated `Processor#version`. ### [`v8.0.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.34...8.0.0) PostCSS 8.0 brings new plugin API, `node_modules` size reduction, better source map support, and CSS parser improvements. Check out [a day-by-day diary](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936) of PostCSS 8.0 development process. #### Known Issues - `postcss-cli` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `gulp-postcss` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `postcss-load-plugins` (used by some environments) can‚Äôt load new plugins #### Thanks to Sponsors With more than [100 M downloads per month](https://npm-stat.com/charts.html?package=postcss), it becomes hard to support PostCSS in free time. For instance, getting the 8.0 release ready took [4 months of work](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936). This release was possible thanks to out community. [**Tailwind CSS**](https://tailwindcss.com/), [**De Voorhoede**](https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/), [**InVision AG**](https://www.ivx.com/), [**Brainbow**](https://opencollective.com/brnbw), and [many individual contributions](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or just wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by: - [**Tidelift**](https://tidelift.com/) with a Spotify-like subscription model and supporting all projects from your lock file. - Direct donations in [**PostCSS & Autoprefixer Open Collective**](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). #### Breaking Changes We try to avoid any breaking changes for end-users: - PostCSS 8 dropped **Node.js 6.x, 8.x, 11.x, and 13.x** versions support. All these versions have no security updates anymore. - We now serve ES6+ sources in the npm package **without Babel** compilation. If you are creating tools like CodePen and put PostCSS into the client-side JS bundle, you may need to run Babel on `node_modules/postcss` for old browsers. - We removed rarely used `postcss.vendor` API. #### New Plugin API The biggest change in PostCSS 8 is a new plugin API. Thanks to [@​BondarenkoAlex](https://togithub.com/BondarenkoAlex) for big help in creating a new API. ```js module.exports = () => { return { postcssPlugin: 'postcss-will-change', Declaration: { 'will-change': (decl, { Declaration }) => { decl.cloneBefore( new Declaration({ prop: 'backface-visibility', value: 'hidden' }) ) } } } } module.exports.postcss = true ``` We know that rewriting old plugins will take time, but the new API will improve the end-user‚Äôs experience and make life easier for plugin developers: - With new API, all plugins can share a single scan of the CSS tree. It makes CSS processing up to **20% faster**. - Because npm often duplicates dependencies, you may have many `postcss` duplicates in your `node_modules`. New API fixes this problem. - Plugins will re-visit changed nodes to **reduce compatibility issues** between plugins. Now the order of plugins in your PostCSS config will be less important. - New API is close to Babel‚Äôs visitor API. These resources will help plugin developers in API migration: - [**The Migration Guide**](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/postcss-8-plugin-migration) - [**Writing a PostCSS Plugin**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/docs/writing-a-plugin.md) - We have a [**Gitter chat**](https://gitter.im/postcss/postcss) open for all questions related to plugin migration. PostCSS development guidelines were also changed: - Now it is prohibited to create own AST on top of PostCSS AST classes since it could lead to [painful bugs](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1305) due to the usage private APIs. - Plugins and runners must have `postcss` in `peerDependencies`. #### New Website without React Previously PostCSS used [a React-based framework](https://togithub.com/phenomic/phenomic) for the project's website. Since we have a static website, we decided to migrate to a React-free framework and got good performance improvements: - **360 ‚Üí 20** ms for Max Potential First Input Delay - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for First CPU Idle - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for Time to Interactive Check out [**postcss.org**](https://postcss.org/) and [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/) that feature the awesome alchemy-inspired design by [@​okonet](https://togithub.com/okonet). We also removed Google Analytics tracking scripts and encourage other open source projects to be an example in caring about user‚Äôs privacy and performance. #### Parser Improvments Did you know that all examples below are valid CSS? ```css :root { --empty: ; --JSON: [1, "2", {"three": {"a":1}}, [4]]; --javascript: function(rule) { console.log(rule) }; } @​supports (--element(".minwidth", { "minWidth": 300 })) { [--self] { background: greenyellow; } } ``` Now PostCSS parses even those rare edge cases correctly. Thanks to Tailwind CSS and Prettier teams for adding more cases to our [CSS parser tests collection](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-parser-tests/). Note that now `--roundMixin: { border-radius: 8px }` will be parsed as a `Declaration` with the `{ border-radius: 8px }` value. #### Better Source Map Support We have added support for two new source map formats: [**Index map**](https://sourcemaps.info/spec.html#h.535es3xeprgt) and [**JSON**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1371) (`data:application/json`). PostCSS 8 is now much closer to the source map spec. Thanks to the Google team for reports: - We now [treat](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1347) `sources` in map **as URLs** instead of file paths. - We now [resolve](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1348) `sources` **relative to map file**, not CSS file. A few source map APIs were added: - `opts.maps.absolute = true` option for [absolute paths](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1352) in source map. - `opts.maps.annotation = (file, root) => url` for a [dynamic path](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1324) to source map. - `Node#origin()` now returns `position.url` in addition to `position.file` for compatibility with absolute URLs in source map‚Äôs `sources`. #### API Changes We have added **ES modules** support and now we **export all classes** from the main entry: ```js import { CssSyntaxError, parse } from "postcss" ``` [@​graberzz](https://togithub.com/graberzz) added [`Node#source.offset`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1325) in addition to `line` and `column`. CSS Custom Properties and Sass-like `$`-variables now have a special `Declaration#variable` mark: ```js const root = parse(` :root { --propery: value; } $variable: value `) root.first.first.variable //=> true root.last.variable //=> true ``` #### TypeScript PostCSS now has a first-class TypeScript support: - We moved API docs from JSDoc to [**TypeDoc**](https://typedoc.org/). Check out our [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/). - We are using [**check-dts**](https://togithub.com/ai/check-dts) to test types with [special unit tests](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/test/errors.ts). - We keep types in separate files for better readability. - With the new structure and test system, we fixed many small issues in types. #### Other Changes - [Fixed calling `replaceWith`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1368) with input replaced node (by [@​josephkaptur](https://togithub.com/josephkaptur)). - Reduce dependencies by replacing `chalk` to [`colorette`](https://togithub.com/jorgebucaran/colorette). - Added `Declaration#value` [auto-conversion](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1373) to string to prevent plugin‚Äôs bugs. - Fixed building PostCSS with Rollup (by [@​MapGrid](https://togithub.com/MapGrid)) because of [circular dependencies](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1321). - Moved unknown source from counter to random IDs: `:10:6`. - Removed docs from the npm package. ### [`v7.0.34`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7034) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.33...7.0.34) - Fix compatibility with `postcss-scss` 2. ### [`v7.0.33`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​7033) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.32...7.0.33) - Add error message for PostCSS 8 plugins.

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>angular/angular</summary>

### [`v11.0.0-next.2`](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1100-next2-2020-09-16)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/compare/11.0.0-next.1...11.0.0-next.2)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **common:** do not round up fractions of a millisecond in `DatePipe` ([#​38009](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38009)) ([26f2820](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/26f2820)), closes [/www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15](https://togithub.com//www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1//issues/sec-15) [#​37989](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37989)
-   **common:** mark locale data arrays as readonly ([#​30397](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/30397)) ([6acea54](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/6acea54)), closes [#​27003](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/27003)
-   **compiler:** source span for microsyntax text att should be key span ([#​38766](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38766)) ([8f349b2](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/8f349b2))
-   **router:** Fix arguments order for call to shouldReuseRoute ([#​26949](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/26949)) ([3817e5f](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/3817e5f)), closes [#​16192](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/16192) [#​16192](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/16192)

##### Features

-   **compiler-cli:** `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to get `Symbol` from a template node ([#​38618](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38618)) ([c4556db](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/c4556db))
-   **compiler-cli:** Add ability to get `Symbol` of `Template`s and `Element`s in component template ([#​38618](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38618)) ([cf2e8b9](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/cf2e8b9))
-   **compiler-cli:** Add ability to get `Symbol` of AST expression in component template ([#​38618](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38618)) ([f56ece4](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/f56ece4))
-   **compiler-cli:** add ability to get symbol of reference or variable ([#​38618](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38618)) ([19598b4](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/19598b4))
-   **compiler-cli:** define interfaces to be used for TemplateTypeChecker ([#​38618](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38618)) ([9e77bd3](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/9e77bd3))

##### Performance Improvements

-   **compiler-cli:** only emit directive/pipe references that are used ([#​38539](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38539)) ([077f516](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/077f516))
-   **compiler-cli:** optimize computation of type-check scope information ([#​38539](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38539)) ([297c060](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/297c060))
-   **router:** use `ngDevMode` to tree-shake error messages in router ([#​38674](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38674)) ([db21c4f](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/db21c4f))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **router:** This change corrects the argument order when calling
    RouteReuseStrategy#shouldReuseRoute. Previously, when evaluating child
    routes, they would be called with the future and current arguments would
    be swapped. If your RouteReuseStrategy relies specifically on only the future
    or current snapshot state, you may need to update the shouldReuseRoute
    implementation's use of "future" and "current" ActivateRouteSnapshots.
-   **common:** The locale data API has been marked as returning readonly arrays, rather
    than mutable arrays, since these arrays are shared across calls to the
    API. If you were mutating them (e.g. calling `sort()`, `push()`, `splice()`, etc)
    then your code will not longer compile. If you need to mutate the array, you
    should now take a copy (e.g. by calling `slice()`) and mutate the copy.
-   **common:** When passing a date-time formatted string to the `DatePipe` in a format that contains
    fractions of a millisecond, the milliseconds will now always be rounded down rather than
    to the nearest millisecond.

Most applications will not be affected by this change. If this is not the desired behaviour
then consider pre-processing the string to round the millisecond part before passing
it to the `DatePipe`.

#### 10.1.2 (2020-09-16)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **compiler:** detect pipes in ICUs in template binder ([#​38810](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38810)) ([ec2dbe7](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ec2dbe7)), closes [#​38539](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38539) [#​38539](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38539) [#​38539](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38539)
-   **core:** clear the `RefreshTransplantedView` when detached ([#​38768](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38768)) ([edb7f90](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/edb7f90)), closes [#​38619](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38619)
-   **localize:** ensure that `formatOptions` is optional ([#​38787](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38787)) ([a47383d](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/a47383d))
-   **router:** Ensure routes are processed in priority order and only if needed ([#​38780](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38780)) ([9c51ba3](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/9c51ba3)), closes [#​38691](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38691)
-   **upgrade:** add try/catch when downgrading injectables ([#​38671](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38671)) ([5de2ac3](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/5de2ac3)), closes [#​37579](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37579)

##### Performance Improvements

-   **compiler-cli:** only emit directive/pipe references that are used ([#​38843](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38843)) ([5658405](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/5658405))
-   **compiler-cli:** optimize computation of type-check scope information ([#​38843](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38843)) ([ebede67](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ebede67))
-   **ngcc:** introduce cache for sharing data across entry-points ([#​38840](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38840)) ([58411e7](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/58411e7))
-   **ngcc:** reduce maximum worker count ([#​38840](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/38840)) ([ea36466](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ea36466))

</details>

Issues.Title: build: update postcss to version 8.0.3 - autoclosed
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | dependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.3`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.3) | | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | devDependencies | major | [`7.0.32` -> `8.0.3`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/7.0.32/8.0.3) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/postcss ### [`v8.0.3`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​803) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.2...8.0.3) - Fixed client-side bundling support. ### [`v8.0.2`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​802) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.1...8.0.2) - Fixed plugin packs support. ### [`v8.0.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​801) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.0.0...8.0.1) - Updated `Processor#version`. ### [`v8.0.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/7.0.32...8.0.0) PostCSS 8.0 brings new plugin API, `node_modules` size reduction, better source map support, and CSS parser improvements. Check out [a day-by-day diary](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936) of PostCSS 8.0 development process. #### Known Issues - `postcss-cli` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `gulp-postcss` need to be updated PostCSS to run new plugins - `postcss-load-plugins` (used by some environments) can‚Äôt load new plugins #### Thanks to Sponsors With more than [100 M downloads per month](https://npm-stat.com/charts.html?package=postcss), it becomes hard to support PostCSS in free time. For instance, getting the 8.0 release ready took [4 months of work](https://twitter.com/PostCSS/status/1273368785592999936). This release was possible thanks to out community. [**Tailwind CSS**](https://tailwindcss.com/), [**De Voorhoede**](https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/), [**InVision AG**](https://www.ivx.com/), [**Brainbow**](https://opencollective.com/brnbw), and [many individual contributions](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or just wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by: - [**Tidelift**](https://tidelift.com/) with a Spotify-like subscription model and supporting all projects from your lock file. - Direct donations in [**PostCSS & Autoprefixer Open Collective**](https://opencollective.com/postcss#section-contributors). #### Breaking Changes We try to avoid any breaking changes for end-users: - PostCSS 8 dropped **Node.js 6.x, 8.x, 11.x, and 13.x** versions support. All these versions have no security updates anymore. - We now serve ES6+ sources in the npm package **without Babel** compilation. If you are creating tools like CodePen and put PostCSS into the client-side JS bundle, you may need to run Babel on `node_modules/postcss` for old browsers. - We removed rarely used `postcss.vendor` API. #### New Plugin API The biggest change in PostCSS 8 is a new plugin API. Thanks to [@​BondarenkoAlex](https://togithub.com/BondarenkoAlex) for big help in creating a new API. ```js module.exports = () => { return { postcssPlugin: 'postcss-will-change', Declaration: { 'will-change': (decl, { Declaration }) => { decl.cloneBefore( new Declaration({ prop: 'backface-visibility', value: 'hidden' }) ) } } } } module.exports.postcss = true ``` We know that rewriting old plugins will take time, but the new API will improve the end-user‚Äôs experience and make life easier for plugin developers: - With new API, all plugins can share a single scan of the CSS tree. It makes CSS processing up to **20% faster**. - Because npm often duplicates dependencies, you may have many `postcss` duplicates in your `node_modules`. New API fixes this problem. - Plugins will re-visit changed nodes to **reduce compatibility issues** between plugins. Now the order of plugins in your PostCSS config will be less important. - New API is close to Babel‚Äôs visitor API. These resources will help plugin developers in API migration: - [**The Migration Guide**](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/postcss-8-plugin-migration) - [**Writing a PostCSS Plugin**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/docs/writing-a-plugin.md) - We have a [**Gitter chat**](https://gitter.im/postcss/postcss) open for all questions related to plugin migration. PostCSS development guidelines were also changed: - Now it is prohibited to create own AST on top of PostCSS AST classes since it could lead to [painful bugs](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1305) due to the usage private APIs. - Plugins and runners must have `postcss` in `peerDependencies`. #### New Website without React Previously PostCSS used [a React-based framework](https://togithub.com/phenomic/phenomic) for the project's website. Since we have a static website, we decided to migrate to a React-free framework and got good performance improvements: - **360 ‚Üí 20** ms for Max Potential First Input Delay - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for First CPU Idle - **3.3 ‚Üí 1.5** seconds for Time to Interactive Check out [**postcss.org**](https://postcss.org/) and [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/) that feature the awesome alchemy-inspired design by [@​okonet](https://togithub.com/okonet). We also removed Google Analytics tracking scripts and encourage other open source projects to be an example in caring about user‚Äôs privacy and performance. #### Parser Improvments Did you know that all examples below are valid CSS? ```css :root { --empty: ; --JSON: [1, "2", {"three": {"a":1}}, [4]]; --javascript: function(rule) { console.log(rule) }; } @​supports (--element(".minwidth", { "minWidth": 300 })) { [--self] { background: greenyellow; } } ``` Now PostCSS parses even those rare edge cases correctly. Thanks to Tailwind CSS and Prettier teams for adding more cases to our [CSS parser tests collection](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-parser-tests/). Note that now `--roundMixin: { border-radius: 8px }` will be parsed as a `Declaration` with the `{ border-radius: 8px }` value. #### Better Source Map Support We have added support for two new source map formats: [**Index map**](https://sourcemaps.info/spec.html#h.535es3xeprgt) and [**JSON**](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1371) (`data:application/json`). PostCSS 8 is now much closer to the source map spec. Thanks to the Google team for reports: - We now [treat](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1347) `sources` in map **as URLs** instead of file paths. - We now [resolve](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1348) `sources` **relative to map file**, not CSS file. A few source map APIs were added: - `opts.maps.absolute = true` option for [absolute paths](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1352) in source map. - `opts.maps.annotation = (file, root) => url` for a [dynamic path](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1324) to source map. - `Node#origin()` now returns `position.url` in addition to `position.file` for compatibility with absolute URLs in source map‚Äôs `sources`. #### API Changes We have added **ES modules** support and now we **export all classes** from the main entry: ```js import { CssSyntaxError, parse } from "postcss" ``` [@​graberzz](https://togithub.com/graberzz) added [`Node#source.offset`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1325) in addition to `line` and `column`. CSS Custom Properties and Sass-like `$`-variables now have a special `Declaration#variable` mark: ```js const root = parse(` :root { --propery: value; } $variable: value `) root.first.first.variable //=> true root.last.variable //=> true ``` #### TypeScript PostCSS now has a first-class TypeScript support: - We moved API docs from JSDoc to [**TypeDoc**](https://typedoc.org/). Check out our [**new API docs**](https://postcss.org/api/). - We are using [**check-dts**](https://togithub.com/ai/check-dts) to test types with [special unit tests](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/test/errors.ts). - We keep types in separate files for better readability. - With the new structure and test system, we fixed many small issues in types. #### Other Changes - [Fixed calling `replaceWith`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1368) with input replaced node (by [@​josephkaptur](https://togithub.com/josephkaptur)). - Reduce dependencies by replacing `chalk` to [`colorette`](https://togithub.com/jorgebucaran/colorette). - Added `Declaration#value` [auto-conversion](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1373) to string to prevent plugin‚Äôs bugs. - Fixed building PostCSS with Rollup (by [@​MapGrid](https://togithub.com/MapGrid)) because of [circular dependencies](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1321). - Moved unknown source from counter to random IDs: `:10:6`. - Removed docs from the npm package.
--- ### Renovate configuration :date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana. :vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Issues.Title: error running yarn start with Bazel in Angular app
Issues.Body:
I was trying to use Bazel to build an Angular app. Here are the things I did -

`yarn ng add @angular/bazel`
`yarn global add @angular/bazel`
`yarn add @bazel/bazelisk`
`yarn global add @bazel/bazel@2.1.0`
`yarn global add @bazel/bazelisk@^1.6.1`
( Because the `package.json` file had those versions) I still get the error -

```
iBazel [3:32PM]: Error getting Bazel info exit status 2
iBazel [3:32PM]: Querying for files to watch...
INFO: Reading rc options for 'query' from /Users/sohinimukherjee/frontend/question-ingestion/.bazelrc:
  Inherited 'common' options: --experimental_allow_incremental_repository_updates
ERROR: --experimental_allow_incremental_repository_updates :: Unrecognized option: --experimental_allow_incremental_repository_updates
```
when I run yarn start which basically runs node --max_old_space_size=8192 node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng serve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error running yarn start with Bazel in Angular app" (#18805)

Issues.Title: Source maps not generated when running with configuration and --watch
Issues.Body:
DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not parse content.  Project Angular CLI version 9.0.0, also tried this in 10.0.0 by upgrading.

The source maps are not generated while running using the configurations from angular.json file.
main.js.map & vendor.js.map are empty.

ng build --project=myproject --aot --configuration=en --watch

In angular json, I have set it as below. This is to inject the Locale_ID, so that i can read it like @Inject(LOCALE_ID) protected localeId: string .

When running using the configuration, source maps are not generated, but without configuration it works fine.

"en": {
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist1",
              "i18nLocale": "en"
            },
            "cy": {
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist2",
              "i18nLocale": "cy"
            }
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Source maps not generated when running with configuration and --watch" (#18803)

This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | dependencies | major | [`9.8.6` -> `10.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/9.8.6/10.0.0) | | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | devDependencies | major | [`9.8.6` -> `10.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/9.8.6/10.0.0) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/autoprefixer ### [`v10.0.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/releases/10.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/compare/9.8.6...10.0.0) Autoprefixer 10 is based on top of [PostCSS 8](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/tag/8.0.0) (check **Known Issues** section before updating). Node.js 6.x, 8.x, 11.x support was removed. Now you need to install Autoprefixer by `npm install --save-dev autoprefixer postcss`. Issues.Title: On ng serve recompiling shows a repeated component declaration in same 2 modules: Type AppComponent is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule and AppModule!
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? In angular version 8.2.14 was working. The bug appears when I upgrade to Angular 10.1.1. ### Description After running first ng serve command the application works fine as it used to do. When the application it is modified at any point, and CLI recompile it, the application crash and it shows the following error in browser console: Error: Type AppComponent is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule and AppModule! Please consider moving AppComponent to a higher module that imports AppModule and AppModule. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent then import that NgModule in AppModule and AppModule. I have read that this error should appear in case the component is declared in two modules, but in the case it is saying that a component is being declared at the same module. This error is showed with all components at every module that is modified, this is just one of them. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I am unable to set a repository with the problem due to the complexity of it, but I insert here configuration files because I think they can be a clue to find the problem. As it is mentioned before, the steps to reproduce it is just to run ng serve, and then force it to recompile at any point. tsconfig.app.json 

{
  "extends": "./tsconfig.json",
  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
    "types": []
  },
  "exclude": ["src/test.ts", "src/**/*.spec.ts", "src/**/*.mock.ts", "**/*.stories.ts", "src/**/*.worker.ts"]    
}
tsconfig.json 

{
  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "module": "es2020",
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "importHelpers": true,
    "noImplicitAny": true,
    "suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors": true,
    "allowJs": true,
    "target": "es2020",
    "typeRoots": ["node_modules/@types"],
    "lib": ["es2018", "dom"],
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "types": ["@types/jest","@types/jquery"],
    "paths": {
      "@app/*": ["src/app/*"],
      "@env/*": ["src/environments/*"],
      "@consts": ["src/app/shared/utils/constants.ts"],
      "@utils": ["src/app/shared/utils/utils.ts"],
      "@core/*": ["src/app/core/*"],
      "@shared/*": ["src/app/shared/*"],
    }
  },
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "preserveWhitespaces": true
  }
}
AppModule 

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    BrowserAnimationsModule,
    QuicklinkModule,
    ServiceWorkerModule.register('./ngsw-worker.js', { enabled: environment.production }),
    HttpClientModule,
    TranslateModule.forRoot(),
    CoreModule,
    SharedModule,
    LoginModule,
    AppRoutingModule,
    RecaptchaV3Module,
    StoreModule.forRoot(reducers, {
      metaReducers,
      runtimeChecks: {
        strictStateImmutability: true,
        strictActionImmutability: true
      }
    }),
    !environment.production
      ? StoreDevtoolsModule.instrument({
        maxAge: 25,
        logOnly: environment.production
      })
      : []
  ],
  declarations: [AppComponent],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }
## üî• Exception or Error 

Error: Type AppComponent is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule and AppModule! Please consider moving AppComponent to a higher module that imports AppModule and AppModule. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent then import that NgModule in AppModule and AppModule.
    at verifySemanticsOfNgModuleDef (core.js:25894)
    at Function.get (core.js:25829)
    at getInjectorDef (core.js:396)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): auto configure hot module replacement (HMR)
Issues.Body:
With this change we configure HMR internally and therefore users which want to use basic HMR functionality will not longer be required to change their application code.

This is important because previously a lot of users missed out on HMR or reported a broken behaviour. This also gives novice/new users a better chance to appreciate HMR and Angular because of the zero effort required to use HMR.

Closes #17324
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): auto configure hot module replacement (HMR)" (#18788)

Issues.Title: test: support Webpack 5 in platform server E2E test
Issues.Body: The platform server E2E test checks for a Webpack specific output to determine if the server module is present.  This output is different for Webpack 5.  This change tries to match either the Webpack 4 or Webpack 5 output.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: support Webpack 5 in platform server E2E test" (#18786)

Issues.Title: Mat-Dialog: Possible memory leak when dialog includes textarea, input, etc.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-yp5k44?file=src/app/dialog-overview-example-dialog.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run application, click on open dialog button
2. Enter text and close dialog, repeat this step.
3. Go to Chrome Memory tab and run head snapshot.  View MyDialogComponent and there are more than one instance created.
4. Refresh chrome tab
5. Open dialog and close without entering into text area
6. Go to Chrome Memory tab and run head snapshot.  View MyDialogComponent and there is only one instance created.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48249724/93419550-1e39ed00-f87b-11ea-946e-4775a645beb9.png)

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

I could be reading the chrome head snapshot incorrectly but I would expect there to be 1 instance of the Dialog component (MyDialogComponent) regardless if I enter something into the text-area or not.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

The number of instances grows by 2 each time the dialog is opened and text is entered into the text-area.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.0
- CDK/Material: 10.2.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Dialog: Possible memory leak when dialog includes textarea, input, etc." (#20595)

Issues.Title: ci: set up commit message conformance rules using ng-dev
Issues.Body:
With this change, commit messages are now checked as they are created locally, and then verified against CI upstream as well.  Local commit message validation failures are treated as warnings, while on CI they are errors which are blocking.

On a bad commit message, you will see something like the following output:
```sh
!  Invalid commit message
Error:
  'badscope' is not an allowed scope.
   => SCOPES: cdk/a11y, cdk/table, (removed scopes to make this less verbose in illustration), youtube-player
The expected format for a commit is:
<type>(<scope>): <summary>
<body>

Before this commit can be merged into the upstream repository, it must be
amended to follow commit message guidelines.
```


---



If you would like commit message validation failures locally to to be treated as errors, failing to create a commit if the commit message validation failed, you can do so by setting a local config in your .ng-dev.user file (which is expected to be in a json format, or a js/ts file providing a default export object).
`.ng-dev.user`
```json
{
  "commitMessage": {
    "errorOnInvalidMessage": true
  }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: set up commit message conformance rules using ng-dev" (#20580)

#### Reproduction

MatTooltip not added role="tooltip" to element in DOM.

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Issues.Title: feat(Datepicker): Add an option for a standalone/inline date range picker
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
The current datepicker and date range picker are implemented as flyouts on an input field, but a standalone date range picker that could be implemented inline would allow for covering use cases where the flyout isn't desired. 

#### Use Case
* As a user, I want to have a form with a date input and display a date picker to the right/below the input field
* As a user, I want to have a form with a start date and end date in separate input fields, with a date range picker calendar displayed below the two fields
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(Datepicker): Add an option for a standalone/inline date range picker" (#20592)

Issues.Title: Datepicker mat-icon-button: Ability to provide unique accessible names for calendar icons
Issues.Body: ### Reproduction: You can find this issue in the Angular Material documentation in the following link. For some of the examples such as **"Comparison Ranges"**, **" Setting the selected date"**, **" Changing the datepicker colors"** etc, there are multiple datepickers used. The programmatic label for calendar icon is not unique to Screen readers, since the aria-label is the same for all. https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/ Steps to reproduce: 1. Navigate to the Date picker documentation: https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/ 2. Navigate to one of the sections that has multiple date picker fields mentioned above. 3. Run JAWS/VoiceOver/NVDA (any screen reader can be used) 4. Verify whether the calendar icon communicates unique accessible names or provide a way to update it (Issue) #### Expected Behavior There needs to be a way to provide unique labels for the calendar icons, if there are more than one date picker fields used in the page. The aria-label for the calendar icon has a value of "Open calendar". There needs to be an alternate way for Screen readers users to differentiate the calendar icon associations to the input field. Using the component as is in the application, there is no means to update the aria-label for the calendar icons. #### Actual Behavior If there are multiple date picker fields, Screen readers will render the same redundant labels making it difficult for Screen readers to differentiate. This is because the aria-label for all the calendar icons are the same. #### Environment - Angular: 10.2.1 - CDK/Material: 10.2.1 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System: Windows/Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Datepicker mat-icon-button: Ability to provide unique accessible names for calendar icons" (#20590)

Issues.Title: How to add [pageSizeOptions]="[5, 10, 25, 100]" to mat-paginator to Table retrieving data through HTTP
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: cdk-virtual-scroll, mat-table: expandable rows work only when scrolling
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Use virtual scroll with a mat-table having expandable rows:
- https://github.com/angular/components/issues/10122#issuecomment-626647861
- https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

Without scrolling the table, rows can be expanded.
Once the table has been scrolled, rows will not expand, until table is further scrolled.

#### Reproduction

StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bug-evpqam?file=src/app/my-table/my-table.component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on a row: the row expands correctly.
2. Scroll to the end.
3. Scroll to the top.
4. Click a row: the row doesn't expand.
5. Scroll a little tiny bit (~50px): previously clicked row expands.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.1
- CDK/Material: 10.2.1
- Browser(s): Firefox, Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdk-virtual-scroll, mat-table: expandable rows work only when scrolling" (#20583)

Issues.Title: feat(material/sort): Implement API to disable sort direction change
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The option to disable a sort direction by adding an attribute to the matSort directive would be nice. Currently, it is possible to disable the 'clear' option, but it is not possible to disable 'asc' or 'desc'.

#### Use Case

I am currently working with an API (which I do not control) that only offers the ability to change the sort column, not the sort direction. It would be nice to be able to disable the 'asc' option, so that the various columns can still be sorted, but clicking again will do nothing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(material/sort): Implement API to disable sort direction change" (#20581)

Issues.Title: bug(MatSelectionList): Ctrl+A does not trigger selectionChange event
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-selection-list-select-deselect-all-no-selection-change-even?file=src/app/list-selection-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select an option
2. Press ctrl+A
 
#### Expected Behavior

Selecting or deselecting all values with keyboard shortcuts should fire selectionChange event.

#### Actual Behavior

It does not.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.1
- CDK/Material: 10.2.1
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10

You can extract the underlying SelectionModel, but it's quite complex when using dynamic template.

Related issue: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/15696
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatSelectionList): Ctrl+A does not trigger selectionChange event" (#20575)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(COMPONENT): No need to configure dialog and bottom sheet via entryComponents
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

Both [dialog](https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview) and [bottom sheet](https://material.angular.io/components/bottom-sheet/overview) states that the components needs to be configured as entryComponents, quote from the docs:

*Similarly to MatDialog, MatBottomSheet instantiates components at run-time. In order for it to work, the Angular compiler needs extra information to create the necessary ComponentFactory for your bottom sheet content component.*

Given the following deps in package.json both components work fine without declaring them as entryComponents:
 
    "dependencies": {
      "@angular/animations": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/cdk": "^10.2.0",
      "@angular/common": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/compiler": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/core": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/flex-layout": "^10.0.0-beta.32",
      "@angular/forms": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/material": "^10.2.0",
      "@angular/platform-browser": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^10.1.0",
      "@angular/router": "^10.1.0",
      "rxjs": "^6.6.0",
      "tslib": "^2.0.0",
      "zone.js": "^0.10.2"
    }

works during local dev `ng s`, and production builds `ng build --prod` and with aot `ng build --aot`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(COMPONENT): No need to configure dialog and bottom sheet via entryComponents" (#20574)

Issues.Title: feat(app.component): Move default boilerplate styles into their own css-file
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

When creating a new boilerplate app with `ng new`, the default styles are put at the top of **app.component.html**, even though the command also creates **app.component.css**, but leaves it empty. This forces the user to move and / or remove the default style from **app.component.html**.

The feature I am suggesting is to generate the default boilerplate app so that the default **app.component** styles are put inside the intended css-file.

#### Use cases

Lessen the amount of boilerplate cleaning inside app.component.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(app.component): Move default boilerplate styles into their own css-file" (#20572)

Issues.Title: feat(dialog): Pass an observable to the mat-dialog-close directive
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

It would be great if we could pass an Observable into the `mat-dialog-close` directive so that the dialog can be closed when the observable emits.

#### Use Case

In our codebase, we use many dialog components for filling up forms. These components usually have the following actions:

```
<mat-dialog-actions>
  <button mat-button mat-dialog-close>Cancel</button>
  <button mat-button (click)="save()">Save</button>
</mat-dialog-actions> 
```

The `save` method usually makes an HTTP POST request to a backend API and, when completes, it closes the dialog using the `close` method of the `MatDialogRef` service.

It would be awesome if we could avoid all the boilerplate code of using the `MatDialogRef` service which also adds a bit of noise in our constructors. Injecting `MatDialogRef` service as `private dialogRef: MatDialogRef<MyComponent>` quickly makes our constructor violate the `max-line-length` rule.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(dialog): Pass an observable to the mat-dialog-close directive" (#20571)

Issues.Title: Moment becomes legacy project
Issues.Body:
Hellow,

I just want to inform that Moment became a legacy project in maintenance mode. See [project status](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/-project-status/). This could have an impact on different datepicker which are using moment for Internationalization and using imports from `@angular/material-moment-adapter`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Moment becomes legacy project" (#20569)

Issues.Title: cdkDropListGroup not connecting nested cdkDropLists
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

If I manually connect two nested lists using the `cdkDropListConnectedTo` moving between lists works as expected. If I try to use `cdkDropListGroup` to connect the nested lists it doesn't work. I verified that `cdkDropListGroup` does work when the lists are not nested.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Here is the flat `cdkDropListGroup`:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/flat-drag-drop-group?file=src/app/app.component.html
    * It works without issue dragging between lists
2. Here are the nested lists using `cdkDropListConnectedTo`: https://stackblitz.com/edit/connected-lists?file=src/app/app.component.html
    * It works without issue dragging between nested lists
3. Here are the nested lists using `cdkDropListGroup`: https://stackblitz.com/edit/nested-drag-drop-group?file=src/app/app.component.html
   * I'm unable to drag and drop between the nested lists
 

#### Expected Behavior

The [angular cdk docs](https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview) say:

> If you have an unknown number of connected drop lists, you can use the `cdkDropListGroup` directive to set up the connection automatically. Note that any new `cdkDropList` that is added under a group will be connected to all other lists automatically.

I was expecting the`cdkDropListGroup` to automatically connect my lists even if they are nested.

#### Actual Behavior

Only by manually connecting the lists was I able to get drag and drop to work between nested lists.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.1
- CDK/Material: 10.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdkDropListGroup not connecting nested cdkDropLists" (#20567)
